page.title: 14THORNHILL OUR CHURCH
page.content: Our church is called Norrieston and it is mentioned as far back as 1649, even before there was a village of Thornhill, only a cluster of houses round the house of a man called Norrie. The building as we know it was opened in March 1880. There is a booklet which was written five years ago to commemorate its centenary. The minister is the Rev. Arthur Law. He is also our chaplain at school. There are 264 adherents at present in his church. Of the 52 children in our school, only 20 go regularly to Sunday School. Sunday Schol is held after church at 12.30 pm. There is also a bible class for older children.
